com.emitrom.flash4j.core.client.media

Class SoundTransform

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.emitrom.flash4j.core.client.ProxyObject
      • com.emitrom.flash4j.core.client.media.SoundTransform

  • public final class SoundTransform
extends ProxyObject
    The SoundTransform class contains properties for volume and panning.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SoundTransform() 
      SoundTransform(double volume)
      New instance.
      SoundTransform(double volume, double panning)
      New instance.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double getLeftToLeft()
      Gets a value, from 0 (none) to 1 (all), specifying how much of the left input is played in the left speaker.
      double getLeftToRight()
      Gets a value, from 0 (none) to 1 (all), specifying how much of the left input is played in the right speaker.
      double getPan()
      Gets tThe left-to-right panning of the sound, ranging from -1 (full pan left) to 1 (full pan right).
      double getRightToLeft()
      Gets a value, from 0 (none) to 1 (all), specifying how much of the right input is played in the left speaker.
      double getRightToRight()
      Gets a value, from 0 (none) to 1 (all), specifying how much of the right input is played in the right speaker.
      double getVolume()
      Gets the volume, ranging from 0 (silent) to 1 (full volume).
      void setLeftToLeft(double leftToLeft)
      Sets a value, from 0 (none) to 1 (all), specifying how much of the left input is played in the left speaker.
      void setLeftToRight(double leftToRight)
      Sets a value, from 0 (none) to 1 (all), specifying how much of the left input is played in the right speaker.
      void setPan(double value)
      Sets the left-to-right panning of the sound, ranging from -1 (full pan left) to 1 (full pan right).
      void setRightToLeft(double rightToLeft)
      Sets a value, from 0 (none) to 1 (all), specifying how much of the right input is played in the left speaker.
      void setRightToRight(double rightToRight)
      Sets a value, from 0 (none) to 1 (all), specifying how much of the right input is played in the right speaker.
      void setVolume(double volume)
      Sets the volume, ranging from 0 (silent) to 1 (full volume).
